alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 12 at 3:09AM MST until March 13 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO WINDY CONDITIONS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Moderately strong west to southwest winds with low humidity and an unstable atmosphere will spread across the northeast and east central plains Sunday afternoon and early evening, where critical fire weather conditions are expected. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and east central plains Sunday afternoon through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
